greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array where row n (n >= 0) gives the numbers remaining after the n-th round of the Flavius sieve, read by descending antidiagonals.
comment: The terms of square array A(row,col) are read by descending antidiagonals as A(0,0), A(0,1), A(1,0), A(0,2), A(1,1), A(2,0), ...
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10439; the first 144 antidiagonals of the array
D. Wilson et al., Interesting sequence, SeqFan list, Nov. 2016
Index entries for sequences generated by sieves
Index entries for sequences related to the Josephus Problem
example: The top left corner of the array:
xref: Cf. A278507 (the numbers removed at each round).
Similarly constructed arrays for other sieves: A258207, A260717.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 23 2016, after _David W. Wilson_'s posting on SeqFan-list Nov 22 2016
